title.narrative: TEB Kosovo Sh A Subordinated Loan

description.narrative: IFC''s expected role in the Project is multifaceted. Its main role lies in supporting a south-south investment to an IDA country through providing a tier II capital loan to a well managed bank sponsored by a partner well known to IFC with a proven track record. In particular, through this Project, IFC would: a) Strengthen the Bank with capital to expand its lending capacity and therefore support access to finance for SMEs; b) Provide its support to a south-south FDI, provided by a long standing IFC client, in an IDA country which would have a demonstration impact to attract similar type of investments into Kosovo; c) Further increase competition in the highly concentrated banking sector of Kosovo; and d) Work together with the Bank to implement best industry practices in sustainable finance such as updating their social and environmental management system. This investment''s direct impact would be to support lending operations of a well managed bank and thus would generate a range of social and economic benefits, including economic growth and employment creation, as well as financial deepening with services and products.

IFCs strategy for Kosovo in the financial sector is to build upon its ongoing activities to support small and medium enterprises (SME) access to finance. In this regard, IFC will actively support banks and non-bank financial institutions through providing medium-term funding to help them increase portfolio levels in a context of reduced available funding sources. In particular, providing capital support through direct equity or through Tier II capital provide much needed leverage for the banks and financial institutions to grow their lending activities. In this context, the proposed investment, a subordinated loan of up to EUR3.5 million to be counted towards Tier II capital of TEB Sh. A (the Bank), is aimed at providing access to finance to the SMEs, through partnering with a leading bank in the country.
